answer: If your laptop is slow, start with a reboot, then check Task Manager CPU/RAM, free disk space (10%+), disable heavy startup apps, and run the Endpoint Health remediation script.
For WiFi issues: forget and rejoin the corporate SSID, toggle airplane mode, run ipconfig /flushdns, reboot, and test a different access point. Escalate if multiple users are affected.
For VPN problems: confirm raw internet access, check time and date, restart the VPN client, re-download the profile if corrupted, and capture the error message/code for escalation.
For Outlook not syncing: restart Outlook, use Send/Receive > Update Folder, repair/recreate the profile, and confirm VPN connectivity if mail requires corporate network access.

If a smart card/PIV is not detected: reinsert the card, try another USB port/reader, restart the smart card middleware/service, then reboot. Test the card on another machine to see if the issue is with the card or device.
